intro: Triteleia × tubergenii, commonly known as the hybrid glory of the valley, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 inches and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is often grown in gardens across the western United States.
